title.narrative: (902.1) LEARNING : INCLUSIVE QUALITY EDUCATION AND EARLY LEARNING

description.narrative: Learning : Inclusive Qualtiy Education adn Early Learning - Every child supported in : having access to , completing and participating in inclusive quality education and early learning, including strengthening governance., which contributes to Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equitable Access To Quality Education (Covid), Learning Outcomes, Learning Outcomes (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Every child supported in : having access to, completing, and participating in inclusive quality education and early learning, including strengthening governance

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Learning : Inclusive Qualtiy Education adn Early Learning - Every child supported in : having access to , completing andparticipating in inclusive quality education and early learning, including strengthening governance.

description.narrative: ECARO strengthened the regional and national capacity to achieve inclusive quality education and learning. ECARO provided technical assistance to COs in strengthening countries’ education system to ensure the provision and continuity of education and learning, particularly for marginalized children. It includes the support for sector analysis/planning, digital learning, inclusive education, learning recovery, safe and healthy learning environment, education in emergency, and evidence generation. ECARO also strengthened UNICEF’s roles in regional coordination for SDG processes through collaboration with UN and other development partners and by ensuring the alignment of COs’ CPD with global and regional education agenda and priorities. | Status:Met | As-of Date:01/03/2022
